# Introduction

This is a book created from markdown and executable code.

Here is a method for including mathematical notation in tables:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
#| label: tbl-1-1
#| tbl-cap: "A table with mathematical symbols"

library(huxtable)

if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
  df <- tibble::tribble(
        ~Symbol,  ~Interpretation,
        "$y$", "Observed value of the outcome variable",
        "$x$", "Observed value of the explanatory variable",
        "$\\beta_0$", "Intercept of the regression line",
        "$\\beta_1$", "Slope of the regression line"
        )

knitr::kable(df, "latex", booktabs=TRUE, escape = F)
}
  
if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
df <- tibble::tribble(
        ~Symbol,  ~Interpretation,
        "\\(y \\)", "Observed value of the outcome variable",
        "\\(x \\)", "Observed value of the explanatory variable",
        "\\(\\beta_0\\)", "Intercept of the regression line",
        "\\(\\beta_1\\)", "Slope of the regression line"
        )

  huxtable(df) |> 
  theme_article() |> 
  set_width(0.8) |> 
    set_escape_contents(TRUE)
}
```
